zh: 某些教士认为，黑潮并不是灾难，而是能够筛选出义人，并清洗无信者的试炼。这些离经叛道的想法很快就湮没在了历史之中，但他们模仿黑潮之力所制造的禁忌武器，依然有一部分失落在海底深处。
en: Some Acolytes believed the Dark Tide was not a disaster but a trial to weed out nonbelievers so that only the Righteous remained. This heretical notion quickly faded into obscurity, but not before the heretics created weapons that harnessed the power of the Dark Tide itself, weapons now lost to the depth of the sea.

zh: “人们应该回归过去的生活，并停留在那里，拒绝一切傲慢的所谓变革。昨天永远比今天更好，今天永远比明天更好。唯有如此，我们才不会对陌生之物感到恐惧，亦不会迷惘。”
en: "Return, people, to ways of old, and cast aside the arrogant boasts of progress. For yesterday's light shall ever outshine today's pale imitation, as today dimly outglows tomorrow's coming darkness. Cling to the known, the tried, the true. Only then may we find shelter from the terrors and confusion of the unknown."
vi: "Con người nên quay về cuộc sống quá khứ, và ở lại đó, từ chối mọi thứ gọi là cải cách kiêu ngạo. Ngày hôm qua mãi mãi tốt hơn hôm nay, hôm nay mãi mãi tốt hơn ngày mai. Chỉ như vậy, chúng ta mới không sợ hãi trước những thứ xa lạ, cũng không hoang mang."

From that moment on, he began carving birds day and night, hoping that the Sentinel would allow him to see his departed mother once more. When the chisel in his hand suddenly fell to the ground, he realized that it was the moment the Sentinel answered his wish.
